answers.answer: I cannot comment on your question regarding diabetes and autonomic dysfunction but there are people on this board who will be able to.I am just wondering if you have had investigations on your spine?  I may be totally off the road here but I have read that syringomelia (sp) can cause symptoms of autonomic dysfunction.

Cathy,I'm sorry, diabetes is outside the scope of my knowledge.  Have you considered cross-posting on the diabetes forum?http://www.medhelp.org/forums/Diabetes---Adult-Type-II/show/46And perhaps the diabetes expert forum (answered by an endocrinologist)?http://www.medhelp.org/forums/Diabetes---Adult-Type-II/show/161There is also the neurology expert forum (answered by Cleveland Clinic neurologists):http://www.medhelp.org/forums/Neurology/show/135

question: Two months ago, I was dx'ed with autonomic small and large fiber neuropathy.  I have a laundry list of symptoms that go with that dx.Yesterday, I was dx'ed with diabetes with a fasting number of 150 and he told me that I could not tolerate the test drinking the sugar solution, whatever that means.  It is hard to believe that I can have such severe autonomic symptoms (disabling) with such a low number.  Is anyone else confined to bed, for the most part, with autonomic symptoms, due to diabetes.  I will see the endocrinologist today to confirm dx.If anyone is in the same boat as me, do you also have severe lower back pain.  Sometimes I hear it is associated, and other times I hear it is not.   The horrible back pain, starts the symptom change of events when I stand or sit too long.  At this point, I am now waking up with it.Thank you for your help-Cathy
